Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance

Work in collaboration with the data engineers to define data models and data points

Light-weight data extraction, transformation, and load from different sources.

Analysis consolidation and Insight sharing, delivering data in a useful and appealing way to all stakeholders

Proactive participation with business to understand, identify data sources, perform analysis and build reports

Be a resource and advocate for data within the organization by teaching and empowering others to use data

Monitoring of the business pulse and extraction of key drivers to business growth.




Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field

3+ Years of professional experience working with Data Analysis, Data Mining, Data Statistics, and other related working experience

Strong in analytics and problem-solving. Proficient in the use of SQL, R, Python, and other data analysis languages, able to extract core results or spot issues from data

Highly analytical mindset and experience in user behavioral research

Experience working with visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau Qlik Sense, or any other

Experience working in an Agile environment

Knowledgeable about performance analysis, experimentations, and statistical tests

Solid interpersonal skills and ability to work in a multicultural environment

Flexibility to grow in a fast-changing team and company

Excellence in presentation, spoken and written skills in English




Plus

Passion for language and education

Additional language skills aside from the required English

Experience working with Cloud computing platforms like AWS, GCP or any other

Experience working with Google Analytics

Experience in the internet industry

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Branddocs is a global tech company with a state-of-the-art choreographer that orchestrates and vaults secure digital transactions. Our TrustCloud Platform helps corporations to secure online transactions worldwide.




Due to our growth, we are looking for a BI Analyst who will be helping develop our Business Intelligence capability. Using data to unearth valuable insights that drive strategic decision making, improve efficiency and maximise productivity.




Duties:




Extraction and analysis of data to the specifications required by the business.
Regular reconciliation and validation of the daily reporting.
Liaise with the Sales Managers to gather requirements for future projects and to ensure alignment of strategic goals.
Build and maintain existing dashboard reports, assisting the Sales team with any queries or troubleshooting issues.
Working cross-departmentally.
Involvement in Group PLC annual report and investor presentations with a focus on producing KPIs.
Interpret data, analyse results and provide ongoing reports.
Identify, analyse and interpret trends or patterns to help shape future direction.
Work with management teams to prioritise business and information needs.
Create a suite of management reports that track key KPI‚Äôs and delivery.
Focus on continuous improvement opportunities.




Requirements:




Native/Bilingual proficiency in English. Spanish is desirable but not required.
In-depth SQL knowledge and understanding of relational schemas, ideally in Microsoft SQL Server.
Good knowledge and experience in Power BI and AWS.
Ability to build and manage BI reports.
Ability to build and maintain dashboards, with drill downs.
4+ years as BI Engineer/Analyst.
Experience with different query languages e.g SQL, Python, Apache Spark, Zepplin.
Confident managing large and complex data sets.
Experience and proficient in BI products.
Develop reports from the data warehouse.
Ability to analyse large data sets.
Excellent organisational skills.
Time management skills.
Capacity to prioritise and delegate tasks.




What we offer:




Career development.
Hybrid work environment.
Competitive remuneration based on your career path.
You will join an established company in the software industry.
Open and innovative environment.

  • Work with management teams to prioritise business and information needs.
  • Create a suite of management reports that track key KPI‚Äôs and delivery.
  • Focus on continuous improvement opportunities.


Requirements:


  • Native/Bilingual proficiency in English. Spanish is desirable but not required.
  • In-depth SQL knowledge and understanding of relational schemas, ideally in Microsoft SQL Server.
  • Good knowledge and experience in Power BI and AWS.
  • Ability to build and manage BI reports.
  • Ability to build and maintain dashboards, with drill downs.
  • 4+ years as BI Engineer/Analyst.
  • Experience with different query languages e.g SQL, Python, Apache Spark, Zepplin.
  • Confident managing large and complex data sets.
  • Experience and proficient in BI products.
  • Develop reports from the data warehouse.
  • Ability to analyse large data sets.
  • Excellent organisational skills.
  • Time management skills.
  • Capacity to prioritise and delegate tasks.


What we offer:


  • Career development.
  • Hybrid work environment.
  • Competitive remuneration based on your career path.
  • You will join an established company in the software industry.
  • Open and innovative environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WPP is the transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients, and communities.




Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 109,000 accomplished people in 110 countries. WPP has headquarters in New York, London and Singapore and a corporate presence in major markets worldwide.




We create transformative ideas and outcomes for our clients through an integrated offer of communications, experience, commerce, and technology.




WPP and our award-winning agencies work with most of the world's biggest companies and organisations ‚Äì from Ford, Unilever and P&G to Google, HSBC, and the UN. Our clients include 61 of the FTSE 100, 317 of the Fortune Global 500, all 30 of the Dow Jones 30 and 62 of the NASDAQ 100. WPP are the leader in the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index and 8th in the FTSE 100 rankings for Women on Boards.




Why we're hiring:




We are looking to hire a Data Analyst based in Madrid.




What you'll be doing:




Interpret stakeholder reporting requirements, analyse data and provide outgoing reports
Become WPPs subject matter expert in all things travel data related
Identify and interpret trends/patterns in large datasets
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing validation reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code & data process problems
Produce and track key performance indicators
Contribute to the ongoing development of a spend analysis tools reporting capabilities
Assist with stakeholder issue resolution
Document end to end reporting process
Support the potential build of a savings & compliance reporting process, both offline and via the tool
Assist with communications process with different business levels internally
Be prepared to work on other complimentary spend reporting projects
Assist in opportunity analysis through further data investigation




What you'll need:




Strong analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills
Willingness to learn new tools and systems
Technology experience or interest
Good attention to detail




Who you are:




You're open : We are inclusive and collaborative; we encourage the free exchange of ideas; we respect and celebrate diverse views. We are accepting: of new ideas, new partnerships, new ways of working.




You're optimistic : We believe in the power of creativity, technology and talent to create brighter futures or our people, our clients and our communities. We approach all that we do with conviction: to try the new and to seek the unexpected.




You're extraordinary: we are stronger together: through collaboration we achieve the amazing. We are creative leaders and pioneers of our industry; we provide extraordinary every day.




What we'll give you:




Passionate, inspired people ‚Äì We promote a culture of people that do extraordinary work.




Scale and opportunity ‚Äì We offer the opportunity to create, influence and complete projects at a scale that is unparalleled in the industry.




Challenging and stimulating work ‚Äì Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge?




WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability. We believe in creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion and strives to recruit a diverse slate of candidates to help us achieve that goal.




Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission




Our company is seeking a skilled data analyst to help us manage and prepare data for our business intelligence (BI) dashboards. As a data analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and organizing large sets of data from various sources within the company. You will then use this data to create accurate and actionable reports and dashboards that provide insights into business performance and trends.




Key Responsabilities




Collect and analyze data from various sources within the company, including sales, marketing, finance, and operations
Develop and maintain accurate and up-to-date databases for use in reporting and analysis
Prepare data for use in business intelligence dashboards and reports
Collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure the accuracy and relevance of data being collected and analyzed
Identify patterns and trends in data to help inform business decisions
Develop and implement strategies to improve data quality and accuracy
Provide training and support to business stakeholders on how to use BI dashboards and reports effectively


WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our IT Team. You will be a key part of the development phase and will bring value to our marketplace, digital platform and other tools that will help us to be the best mobility solution in Europe.Bachelor's degree in computer science, data analytics, or a related field




So, the requirements for this position are:




At least 2 years of experience working with data analysis and reporting tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Familiarity with data management and database design principles
Knowledge of statistics and data modeling techniques is a plus





To join us you must be a real Panda. If you want to get it, this is the Way of the Panda:
And, overall, we enjoy the journey together... a lot :)About us




Care for Customers & Environment
Hungry & Ambitious: impact, growth, bar-riser, 212¬∫
Work Ethic: Ownership, autonomous, trust, doer
Team Player: PandaGo‚Äôs over own agenda, supportive
High Potential: Coachable, sharp, curious, resourcefuTo join us you must be a real Panda. WHAT DO WE OFFER?
Welcome pack with every tool you will need for your daily mission.
Permanent contract with a very attractive package and unlimited variable pay on company performance.
Relevant company perks (health insurance, gympass, flex comp, ‚Ä¶) and summer fridays the whole year!
An optimal and nurturing work environment with a multicultural and inclusive team.
A dynamic environment of entrepreneurship, with agility and a growth mindset.
A professional team with experience in leading companies such as Google, Facebook, Sony, Vodafone and many StartUps from whom you can learn.
A real opportunity to grow your personal and professional profile, starting from the selection process.
Possibility to help build a better world.





At PandaGo we help create sustainable cities, making it easy for any company to adopt electric mobility solutions for its activity and its employees.




PandaGo is a technology company in the B2B sustainable mobility space. Headquartered in Madrid, Spain and expanding throughout Europe, our ‚ÄúFleet-as-a-Service‚Äù turnkey solution integrates a zero-emissions vehicle rental marketplace with self-developed software for managing multi-vehicle & multi-supplier fleet operations as well as outsourced electrification strategy & fleet management services.




We have delivered to our customers hundreds of EVs, avoiding the emission of more than 1.000 tons of CO2. It would take over 100.000 trees to convert that amount of CO2 to oxygen in a year‚Ä¶ and this is only the beginning!




We have three main objectives:




100% Sustainable Urban Mobility
Build the leading B2B electric mobility Platform
Build the best team with a great culture that attracts talent.





During 2023 we are going to keep developing our platform and we‚Äôll grow internationally. Due to this, we are looking for the most talented professionals, capable of changing the world for the better.




Do you want to make a positive impact? Do you dare to be part of the change? Our mission needs the best people and surely you are one of them.

Somos una empresa espa√±ola l√≠der en servicios tecnol√≥gicos y atracci√≥n del talento presente en el mercado desde 1995. Contamos con m√°s de 600 empleados en proyectos tanto nacionales como internacionales en sector TI.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO ARE WE?

Afiniti is the world‚Äôs leading applied artificial intelligence and advanced analytics provider. Afiniti Enterprise Behavioral Pairing‚Ñ¢ uses artificial intelligence to identify subtle and valuable patterns of human interaction in order to pair individuals on the basis of behavior, leading to more successful interactions and measurable increases in enterprise profitability. Afiniti operates throughout the world, and has measurably driven billions of dollars in incremental value for our clients.

PURPOSE

Working within Spanish team in Client Data Services, you will be a key member who enjoys rolling up their sleeves to solve complex business questions through data. You will be the main support to the Client Data Mgr/Sr Manager, and will be working with the client during the customer life cycle. You will be responsible for supporting on reconciliation and invoicing and you will be doing complex analysis to give response to client and business needs.

You will have a passion for data and be able to move between complex data structures and SQL/R/Python models easily. You will help to pro-actively identify and create relevant, insightful analysis and will look to automate and visualize to improve efficiencies communicate effectively.

Responsibilities

Support the in-country Client Data Services Manager/Snr. Management in all analysis and data reconciliation tasks. Assist on internal and client discussions on data reconciliation and invoicing across accounts
Utilize statistical and analytical methods to assist in the provision of relevant and useful insights/analysis to the business team and client on the business, strategy and contact centre operations.
Build an automated portfolio of analysis to increase efficiencies and support to the business and client. Use Visualization tools to help story telling the insights.
Assist the Client Data Services Manager/Snr. Manager in the accurate documentation provided to internal and client teams.
Help the Snr. Manager of Client Data Services in the short and medium-term planning of the CDS team, documenting and tracking all planned and ad-hoc tasks.
Perform other duties as assigned - prepare succinct, clear, and easy to follow documents that summarize findings and insights. Deal effectively with day-to-day account issues as they arise.

YOUL WILL HAVE

3-4 years of working experience
Experience of working in a client facing role; consulting experience preferred
Strong knowledge and skills in SQL essential; R and Python would be beneficial
Knowledge of ETL processes and visualization tools highly desirable
Expertise at understanding data structures/dictionaries, data feeds and their associated potential and value
MS Office Suite skills ‚Äì particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint
The ability to manage internal stakeholders in ensuring that tasks are received, and updates given in a timely and efficient manner
The ability to convey mathematical concepts in meaningful way to internal team members and clients
The ability to work independently and in a team environment. The individual will be able to work as part of a team across functions, levels and disciplines
Strong knowledge and understanding of statistical concepts and the ability to present complex data analytics and recommendations simply and effectively
Strong problems solving and critical thinking skills, the candidate is a natural problem solver
Fluency in Spanish & English. The ability to influence teams in English. Client Data Services is a global team, the candidate must be able to communicate complex concepts in the language.

Education & Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science/ Mathematics/ Economics/ Statistics/ Electronics/Electrical Engineering or Physics

SALARY & PACKAGE

As well as a competitive base salary dependent on the number of years of experience, we also offer generous stock options, an annual discretionary bonus plus Corporate benefits.

We believe that richness in diversity is a huge asset for Afiniti. We value both the similarities and differences in everyone who is a part of the Afiniti team. We believe that this diversity builds a stronger organization and is in keeping with the core values of our company. Our policy, therefore, is to provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, related medical conditions, breastfeeding or reproductive health decisions), gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, personal appearance, genetic information, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, military or veteran status, or any other category protected under applicable federal, state or local law. This means that we comply with all applicable human rights and employment legislation, and we do not discriminate in any aspect of employment, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotions, reductions in force, or terminations.

Title: Data Analyst, Competitive Intelligence
Description:
üëã You found us. Awesome. Something led you here, maybe a glimpse of potential and something amazing? Well that‚Äôs how we feel about Klue.




Who are we?




Klue is a VC backed, capital-efficient high growth SaaS. Tiger Global and Salesforce Ventures led our US$62m Series B in the fall of 2021. We‚Äôre creating the category of competitive enablement: helping companies understand their market and outmaneuver their competition. We benefit from having an experienced leadership team working alongside several hundred risk-taking builders who elevate every day.




We‚Äôre one of Canada‚Äôs Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone HC, a Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & Fast 500 winner, and recipient of both the Startup of the Year and Tech Culture of the Year awards at the Technology Impact Awards.




The Insights' team scope covers data validation for existing sources, outsourced content, and new potential data sources. This role is focused on quality checks at scale and you will be key in ensuring that our data providers and outsourced content creators are delivering high-quality content that is linked back to source data. As the data marketplace is always evolving, you will also be involved in POC's of new data sources that can support manual curation initiatives.




This is You:




Highly analytical and critical thinker
Ability to digest and communicate complex data
You like ambiguity and thrive in fast-paced environments
You are an Excel and/or Python master
Strong communicator and natural networker
You like to learn new things and are keen to become an expert


Lastly, we take potential into consideration. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be accepted in lieu of the specifics listed above. If you know you have what it takes, even if that‚Äôs different from what we‚Äôve described, be sure to explain why in your application. Reach out and let‚Äôs see if there is a home here for you now or in the future.




We‚Äôve made a commitment to support and contribute to a diverse environment; on our teams and in our community. We‚Äôre early in our journey; we've started employee led resource groups, committed to Pay Up For Progress, and use success profiles for roles instead of 'years of experience'. We continue to scale our efforts as Klue grows. We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have dedicated that commitment to our current and future #kluecrew. During the interview process, please let us know if there is anything we need to make more accessible or accommodate to support you to be successful.




All interviews will be conducted via video calls. We work in a hybrid model of WFH (remote) and in-office. We‚Äôre excited to meet you and in the meantime, get to know us:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Robert Half is looking to hire a Data Analyst located in BC. This person will take responsibility for managing databases and troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases. This is a full-time contract opportunity based primarily in Burnaby, BC.

Requirements

3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst
Advanced knowledge of SQL Queries
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Power BI
Experience with PHP is considered an asset but is not required

Robert Half is the world‚Äôs first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity ‚Äì even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4429. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Launched in 2019, BAM Management US Holdings Inc. d/b/a Binance.US ("Binance.US") is the fastest growing and most integrated digital asset marketplace in the United States, powered by matching engine and wallet technologies license from the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange - Binance. Our mission is to provide liquidity, transparency, and efficiency to financial markets by creating products that leverage crypto to unlock the power of everything. We build bridges between traditional finance and digital markets that enable growth for all‚Äîempowering the future of finance. Binance.US is operated by BAM Trading Services.

As a product analyst at Binance.US, your mission is to understand and explain how the end users interact with our products and how that impacts Binance.US as a business. Based on your insights, you will make recommendations for product development and identify business opportunities. You will work closely with product managers and engineers as well as designers on developing Binance.US' consumer offering and have a direct impact on Binance.US' success.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with PMs, designers, engineers, and data scientists to optimize and develop consumer-facing products
Develop and track the actionable KPIs and metrics
Analyze UX and customer journeys to identify opportunities and improvement
Get the right tracking implemented for every feature and main it
Setup, monitor, and analyze AB tests continuously to improve features and design
Take care of the data pipeline of the team (if needed)
Build up dashboards and prepare reviews/ meetings
Analyze the financial performance of Binance.US' consumer offering, understand the unit economics and contribution
Be a driving force in product development, backing up suggestions with evidence and deriving actionable insights
Facilitate data-driven decision-making across the company


Requirements

4+ years of experience in Data Analytics
Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English
Previous experience in a fast-growing tech company
Excellent at communicating and presenting insights
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in your work
Strong business acumen and data analysis ability to help stakeholders make data-driven decisions
Able to manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Experience building compelling dashboards using data visualization tools (experience with Tableau is a plus)
Fluent in SQL
Experienced with AB tests and working on basic statistics
Experience in Python or R is a plus
Experience in AARRR analysis in a consumer-facing tech company is highly preferred


Binance.US is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our mission is to give Americans access to a broad array of digital assets, and we thrive because of the diverse and inclusive team that we are building. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

Binance.US complies with Federal Transparency in Coverage regulations by providing this link to machine readable files related to the health plans offered to our employees. The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data including negotiated service rates, and out-of-network allowed amounts between health plans and healthcare providers.

Kaiser Permanente

www.aetna.com

Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst Health Surveillance
Description:
Data Analyst Health Surveillance




BC Centre for Disease Control




Vancouver, BC




In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position. The Data Analyst, working within a designated service line, provides data management and maintenance services, ensures quality and integrity of data for the various information systems, performs regular analysis of data, and supports information system use by departmental staff. The Data Analyst reports to the Coordinator for Data Standards and Integration, and has a functional relationship to the service line the Analyst is assigned to.




What You‚Äôll Do




Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, transformation, and documentation. Develops and maintains data collection and recording systems such as databases, spreadsheets, and web-sites, including designing ad hoc reports. Writes computer code and data queries to capture and edit data, and/or liaises with information systems department for same. Creates analytic reporting tools to allow internal and external users to analyze data. Receives and responds to ongoing requests to evaluate data, systems, processes and procedures. Automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools.
Performs descriptive analyses and produces summaries and analytical reports using statistical software and coding, identifying all data limitations that apply. Identifies issues, trends, and developments. Communicates findings to Centre staff and external stakeholders at the local, provincial and federal level. Automates routine analyses using standard programming tools.
Monitors data quality in the information systems like the Public Health Information System and disease databases, proactively identifies and communicates anomalies that indicate data quality issues, and ensures that data used for analysis purposes or distributed to stakeholders is of the highest quality possible. Follows up with regional health authorities on missing, erroneous, and duplicate data to achieve high quality data. Corrects data errors in a timely manner. Documents processes for these procedures.
Prepares and maintains documentation and reports such as user guides, procedure manuals, metadata, code documentation, data security policies and data dictionaries.
Supports data security by assigning and deleting access for various applications and network file systems. Ensures the secure transfer of patient data to stakeholders when authorized to.
Assists as needed with gathering data, entering data, researching historical and archival data, accessing on-line databases, performing interviews, and obtaining data from national, provincial and local agencies and individuals. Links data from separate sources such as the client registry and MSP.
Provides training and user support to users on software applications used by department staff. Attains high-level proficiency with the centre‚Äôs data warehouse and related tools in order to train and support staff in the assigned service line.
Maintains the departmental content on the Inter, Extra and Intra nets. Recommends and implements changes to, and development of, web sites, and web site content. Adds links, URLs, PDFs, MS Excel files, word documents and graphics to web sites using html programming language.
Participates in review, critique/ enhancement identification, documentation, and planning of systems such as the centre‚Äôs data warehouse, providing information about data requirements and workflows as needed.
Coordinates the placement of the rotating co-op student in the department, provides orientation, assigns and oversees their activities, and evaluates their performance.
Performs other related duties as assigned.




Qualifications




What you bring




Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Health Information Science or Computer Science or equivalent and three (3) years‚Äô experience as a data analyst/scientist, preferably in community health and/or the health information field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.




Skills & Knowledge




Commitment to upholding the shared responsibility of creating lasting and meaningful reconciliation in Canada as per TRC (2015) and BC's Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act (2019).
As a strong asset for consideration, we are looking for our successful candidate to have: Knowledge of social, economic, political and historical realities impacting indigenous communities and familiarity with Indigenous Cultural Safety and anti-racism and accompanying reports (BC DRIPA, TRC, etc.).
Ability to write data management and analysis programs using data programming tools such as SAS or R.
Experience managing and querying data in large relational or multidimensional databases and data warehouses an asset.
Ability to create data visualizations.
Knowledge of standard software packages, spreadsheet, statistical, graphical, database, communication and web software.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics.
Knowledge of PC systems and applications.
Familiarity with health-related terminology.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to operate related equipment
Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.




What We Bring




Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre focused on your care too ‚Äì offering health, wellness, development programs to support you ‚Äì at work and at home.




Join one of BC‚Äôs largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations ‚Äì offering vast opportunities for growth, development, and recognition programs that honour the commitment and contribution of all employees.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San‚Äôyas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Access to WorkPerks, a premium discount program offering a wide range of local and national discounts on electronics, entertainment, dining, travel, wellness, apparel, and more.

Reconciliation is an ongoing process and a shared responsibility for all of us. The BC Governments‚Äô unanimous passage of the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act was a significant step forward in this journey‚Äîone that all health authorities are expected to support as we work in cooperation with Indigenous Peoples to establish a clear and sustainable path to lasting reconciliation. HTML:
Data Analyst Health Surveillance


BC Centre for Disease Control


Vancouver, BC


In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position. The Data Analyst, working within a designated service line, provides data management and maintenance services, ensures quality and integrity of data for the various information systems, performs regular analysis of data, and supports information system use by departmental staff. The Data Analyst reports to the Coordinator for Data Standards and Integration, and has a functional relationship to the service line the Analyst is assigned to.


What You‚Äôll Do


  • Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, transformation, and documentation. Develops and maintains data collection and recording systems such as databases, spreadsheets, and web-sites, including designing ad hoc reports. Writes computer code and data queries to capture and edit data, and/or liaises with information systems department for same. Creates analytic reporting tools to allow internal and external users to analyze data. Receives and responds to ongoing requests to evaluate data, systems, processes and procedures. Automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools.
  • Performs descriptive analyses and produces summaries and analytical reports using statistical software and coding, identifying all data limitations that apply. Identifies issues, trends, and developments. Communicates findings to Centre staff and external stakeholders at the local, provincial and federal level. Automates routine analyses using standard programming tools.
  • Monitors data quality in the information systems like the Public Health Information System and disease databases, proactively identifies and communicates anomalies that indicate data quality issues, and ensures that data used for analysis purposes or distributed to stakeholders is of the highest quality possible. Follows up with regional health authorities on missing, erroneous, and duplicate data to achieve high quality data. Corrects data errors in a timely manner. Documents processes for these procedures.
  • Prepares and maintains documentation and reports such as user guides, procedure manuals, metadata, code documentation, data security policies and data dictionaries.
  • Supports data security by assigning and deleting access for various applications and network file systems. Ensures the secure transfer of patient data to stakeholders when authorized to.
  • Assists as needed with gathering data, entering data, researching historical and archival data, accessing on-line databases, performing interviews, and obtaining data from national, provincial and local agencies and individuals. Links data from separate sources such as the client registry and MSP.
  • Provides training and user support to users on software applications used by department staff. Attains high-level proficiency with the centre‚Äôs data warehouse and related tools in order to train and support staff in the assigned service line.
  • Maintains the departmental content on the Inter, Extra and Intra nets. Recommends and implements changes to, and development of, web sites, and web site content. Adds links, URLs, PDFs, MS Excel files, word documents and graphics to web sites using html programming language.
  • Participates in review, critique/ enhancement identification, documentation, and planning of systems such as the centre‚Äôs data warehouse, providing information about data requirements and workflows as needed.
  • Coordinates the placement of the rotating co-op student in the department, provides orientation, assigns and oversees their activities, and evaluates their performance.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications


What you bring


  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Health Information Science or Computer Science or equivalent and three (3) years‚Äô experience as a data analyst/scientist, preferably in community health and/or the health information field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Skills & Knowledge


  • Commitment to upholding the shared responsibility of creating lasting and meaningful reconciliation in Canada as per TRC (2015) and BC's Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act (2019).
  • As a strong asset for consideration, we are looking for our successful candidate to have: Knowledge of social, economic, political and historical realities impacting indigenous communities and familiarity with Indigenous Cultural Safety and anti-racism and accompanying reports (BC DRIPA, TRC, etc.).
  • Ability to write data management and analysis programs using data programming tools such as SAS or R.
  • Experience managing and querying data in large relational or multidimensional databases and data warehouses an asset.
  • Ability to create data visualizations.
  • Knowledge of standard software packages, spreadsheet, statistical, graphical, database, communication and web software.
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics.
  • Knowledge of PC systems and applications.
  • Familiarity with health-related terminology.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to operate related equipment
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.


What We Bring


Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre focused on your care too ‚Äì offering health, wellness, development programs to support you ‚Äì at work and at home.


  • Join one of BC‚Äôs largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations ‚Äì offering vast opportunities for growth, development, and recognition programs that honour the commitment and contribution of all employees.
  • Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San‚Äôyas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
  • Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
  • Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
  • PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
  • Access to WorkPerks, a premium discount program offering a wide range of local and national discounts on electronics, entertainment, dining, travel, wellness, apparel, and more.

Title: Data Intern
Description:
Launched in 2019, BAM Management US Holdings Inc. d/b/a Binance.US ("Binance.US") is the fastest growing and most integrated digital asset marketplace in the United States, powered by matching engine and wallet technologies license from the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange - Binance. Our mission is to provide liquidity, transparency, and efficiency to financial markets by creating products that leverage crypto to unlock the power of everything. We build bridges between traditional finance and digital markets that enable growth for all‚Äîempowering the future of finance. Binance.US is operated by BAM Trading Services.

Responsibilities:

Create and maintain impactful data visualizations and dashboards using Tableau to support various products and features within the company
Develop and implement data pipelines that ensure the timely and accurate delivery of data for analysis
Drive the development of product analytics, providing valuable insights and recommendations for improvement
Produce regular and ad-hoc analytical reports that inform business decisions and help drive key initiatives
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for data-driven improvements and support data-related initiatives across the organization


Requirements:

B.S. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science & Analytics, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics, or a related field.
Previous internship or project experience in data analytics, data science, or business intelligence preferred.
Fluency with SQL and proficiency with at least one of R or Python.
Knowledge of data visualization best practices and experience with Tableau or similar tools is a must.
A proactive and methodical approach to work, with a strong sense of initiative and the ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
A keen eye for detail, combined with a creative and analytical approach to problem-solving
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, as well as a strong desire to learn and grow in a dynamic and challenging environment
Passion for crypto or relevant background is a plus.


Binance.US is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our mission is to give Americans access to a broad array of digital assets, and we thrive because of the diverse and inclusive team that we are building. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

Binance.US complies with Federal Transparency in Coverage regulations by providing this link to machine readable files related to the health plans offered to our employees. The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data including negotiated service rates, and out-of-network allowed amounts between health plans and healthcare providers.

Title: Data Analyst - Molecular Design & Engineering
Description:
AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to help integrate data and design software and data processes in the areas of antibody discovery and engineering. The successful candidate will interact with a diverse team, liaising between software engineers, wet-lab scientists, bioinformaticians and protein engineers, in a fast-paced environment. Our ideal candidate is able to multitask, problem-solve, think critically and demonstrate scientific rigor, and above all, someone who can learn and grow with us.

This is an exciting opportunity to join one of Canada‚Äôs most innovative biotech companies and to contribute to our cutting-edge research, driving the discovery of novel monoclonal antibodies for therapeutic use.

How you might spend your days:

Working with bioinformaticians and protein engineers to help develop and implement strategies for data analysis, curation, storage, presentation and interpretation to answer increasingly complex questions with ease
Collaborating with software engineers and data scientists across the organization to standardize processes, including integration into our data warehouse, laboratory information management systems (LIMS), and electronic notebooks (ELN)
Supporting the development of software tools to collate, organize and process data for integration with data analysis and visualization platforms
Contributing to the implementation and maintenance of analysis pipelines (typically in Python), ensuring data integrity, correctness and clarity
Organizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines
Analyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues


We'd love to hear from you if:

You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environment
You are excited about the opportunity to integrate large-scale data with in silico tools to solve real-world drug discovery problems
You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy bringing out the best in your teammates
You enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment and coordinating with your team to juggle multiple competing priorities
You take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solver
You can effectively communicate scientific data across disciplines and levels of experience


Required qualifications and experience:

MSc in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, or a related field, or BSc in a relevant field with 3+ years of related experience
Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python preferred); demonstrated experience designing, testing, and debugging code in a collaborative development environment would be preferred
Experience working with data provenance, and creating data architectures and databases
Demonstrated ability to create flexible, reproducible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others
Excellent documentation skills with impeccable attention to detail
A background in relevant areas of life sciences is a bonus, including Structural Biology, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, or Immunology


Offers & benefits:

The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefits
A minimum of 3 weeks‚Äô vacation
Opportunities for personal and professional development


About AbCellera:

At AbCellera, we‚Äôre solving tough problems and creating innovative solutions from the ground up - custom immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation. We‚Äôre revolutionizing how our scientists can explore antibodies and the scale at which they can do so. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.

You‚Äôll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. We‚Äôre a growing company with a high-throughput pipeline and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn‚Äôt just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of visionaries and innovators. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We‚Äôre looking for someone like you to help us get there.

To apply:

Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 23056 in your cover letter. We apologize in advance, but we receive a large volume of applications and are only able to contact those who are selected for an interview.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Launched in 2019, BAM Management US Holdings Inc. d/b/a Binance.US ("Binance.US") is the fastest growing and most integrated digital asset marketplace in the United States, powered by matching engine and wallet technologies license from the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange - Binance. Our mission is to provide liquidity, transparency, and efficiency to financial markets by creating products that leverage crypto to unlock the power of everything. We build bridges between traditional finance and digital markets that enable growth for all‚Äîempowering the future of finance. Binance.US is operated by BAM Trading Services.

As a product analyst at Binance.US, your mission is to understand and explain how the end users interact with our products and how that impacts Binance.US as a business. Based on your insights, you will make recommendations for product development and identify business opportunities. You will work closely with product managers and engineers as well as designers on developing Binance.US' consumer offering and have a direct impact on Binance.US' success.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with PMs, designers, engineers, and data scientists to optimize and develop consumer-facing products
Develop and track the actionable KPIs and metrics
Analyze UX and customer journeys to identify opportunities and improvement
Get the right tracking implemented for every feature and main it
Setup, monitor, and analyze AB tests continuously to improve features and design
Take care of the data pipeline of the team (if needed)
Build up dashboards and prepare reviews/ meetings
Analyze the financial performance of Binance.US' consumer offering, understand the unit economics and contribution
Be a driving force in product development, backing up suggestions with evidence and deriving actionable insights
Facilitate data-driven decision-making across the company


Requirements

4+ years of experience in Data Analytics
Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English
Previous experience in a fast-growing tech company
Excellent at communicating and presenting insights
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in your work
Strong business acumen and data analysis ability to help stakeholders make data-driven decisions
Able to manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Experience building compelling dashboards using data visualization tools (experience with Tableau is a plus)
Fluent in SQL
Experienced with AB tests and working on basic statistics
Experience in Python or R is a plus
Experience in AARRR analysis in a consumer-facing tech company is highly preferred


Binance.US is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our mission is to give Americans access to a broad array of digital assets, and we thrive because of the diverse and inclusive team that we are building. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

  • Be a driving force in product development, backing up suggestions with evidence and deriving actionable insights
  • Facilitate data-driven decision-making across the company

Requirements
  • 4+ years of experience in Data Analytics
  • Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English
  • Previous experience in a fast-growing tech company
  • Excellent at communicating and presenting insights
  • Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in your work
  • Strong business acumen and data analysis ability to help stakeholders make data-driven decisions
  • Able to manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Experience building compelling dashboards using data visualization tools (experience with Tableau is a plus)
  • Fluent in SQL
  • Experienced with AB tests and working on basic statistics
  • Experience in Python or R is a plus
  • Experience in AARRR analysis in a consumer-facing tech company is highly preferred

Binance.US is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our mission is to give Americans access to a broad array of digital assets, and we thrive because of the diverse and inclusive team that we are building. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

Binance.US complies with Federal Transparency in Coverage regulations by providing this link to machine readable files related to the health plans offered to our employees. The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data including negotiated service rates, and out-of-network allowed amounts between health plans and healthcare providers.

www.aetna.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Role ‚Äì Senior Data Analyst (this is not a technical role but a data interpretation role)

Are you looking for the next challenge in your career and believe in a data driven approach to business decisions? Have you been wanting to make more of an impact to an organization and thrive in a roll-up-your-sleeves, team-oriented, collaborative business environment? Do you believe that high quality work can be accomplished with no geographical boundaries?

Our client is introducing a new analytics capability within the company and is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to play a lead role in the communication, mentoring, discovery and buildout's of this new capability. The analytics department will be primarily responsible for action driven analysis that drive company profits through product innovation, cost/revenue drivers and business process improvement using a data driven approach.

Key Responsibilities

By now you are probably asking‚Ä¶‚Äù what is the day to day like‚Äù? How much do you love a whiteboard? First and foremost, you will gain a deep understanding of the business and how we achieve profitability. With this knowledge you will begin to ask questions, use critical thought an theorize the potential in which the company can increase profitability. Then prove out those theories using empirical data to deliver a story for the business to take action. Let‚Äôs not forget that you will be mentoring and shaping the analytics department to deliver next level analytics to the organization (Did we mention the whiteboard sessions?)

Required Skills & Experience

Proven track record of innovating complex analysis that resulted in action taken by the company to increase profits.
Success with leading a team of Data Scientist/Data Analysts
Proven expertise in advanced analytics and data science techniques, including building, testing, and deploying predictive/regression models as well as Time-Series Modeling
Hands on experience coding in R, Python, SAS, SQL or similar database, statistical and optimization languages
Collaborate with operational/IT business leads to recognize and help adopt best practices in data analysis.
5-7 years in an analytics/statistical environment with a progressive career path.
Bachelors or Masters degree related to technology/mathematics or computer science is preferred

Title: Data Analyst 4
Description:
Job Description:

Focused on designing the next generation of electro-mechanical solutions to serve prosumers in their residential storage and solar needs.

Responsibilities

¬∑ Support electrical design throughout the engineering process from initial concept to final production release.

¬∑ Design electrical hardware through creation of single line diagrams, circuit diagrams, component selection & simulations

¬∑ Support PCB layout and collaborate with mechanical and firmware engineers to successfully develop and validate the design.

¬∑ Build prototypes, develop test plans, perform, and support electrical tests (Board bring up, DVT EMI/EMC), and analyze data to optimize the designs for performance, size, cost, manufacturability, and reliability.

¬∑ Lead the PCBA, system troubleshooting & design change activities.

¬∑ Support the installation and maintenance of the electrical prototypes.

¬∑ Support quality team for various reliability analyses (DMA, MTBF, THB, critical component)

Skills & Qualifications

¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs/ Master‚Äôs degree in electrical engineering

¬∑ 8+ years of experience related to Electrical engineering, including design, testing, estimates, and troubleshooting.

¬∑ Strong power electronics skills with hands-on experience with AC Systems (Split phase 240V, 60Hz) and low voltage DC systems

¬∑ Hands on experience in Analog and Digital circuit designs

¬∑ Hands-on experience with schematic design software with preference for PADS & OrCAD

¬∑ Experienced with UL certification, National Electrical Code, and IEC standards.

About US Tech Solutions:

Your talent, our opportunities - This is the premise behind US Tech Solutions.

You have the skill we have the opportunity. As a team, we work passionately for you to get the right career opportunity across industry verticals and functions. For past sixteen years, leading Global

Companies and Fortune 500 come to us to get the right talent. Whether you want to work as full-time, contractor or part-time, technical or non-technical our talent consultants will connect with the right career opportunity globally.

Connect with our talent team today.

USTECH was founded in 2000 by Manoj Agarwal. Today, we are a global firm offering talent solutions to 150 customers including 20% of Fortune 500 across Financial Services, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Aerospace, Energy, Retail, Telecom, Technology, Manufacturing, and Engineering. We are headquartered in New Jersey with 40 global locations across the USA, Canada, Europe, and India. Deloitte has recognized USTECH as one of the fastest growing private businesses for the past five consecutive years and INC 500 for the past three. We have also been rated ‚ÄúThe Top Business in the US" by Diversity Business since 2011. To learn more about how US Tech Solutions visit our website: www.ustechsolutions.com.

‚ÄúUS Tech is an Equal Opportunity Employer" and ‚ÄúCanadian Citizens & all other parties authorized to work in the Canada are encouraged to apply."

Title: Purchasing Data Analyst
Description:
Sunrise Farms is a group of companies that has grown from an initial focus in the poultry industry including hatchery operations; poultry farming; primary processing; and further processing; to distribution of other protein products across Canada.




Our humble start was in 1983 with one small processing facility in Surrey, British Columbia. We have now grown to serve a broad range of customers, both domestically and internationally. Sunrise Farms remains Canadian family owned, producing quality food products from processing plants located in British Columbia, Alberta, Manitoba and Ontario.




We have approximately 3,200 full-time and part-time employees who are experienced, dedicated to their craft, and exceptional at delivering quality products from farm to table.




We are proud of our long-standing partnerships with family-owned Canadian chicken farmers to produce high-quality products. We take our role in the farm to table process very seriously and are honored to deliver farm fresh Canadian food to Canadian tables from coast to coast.




The Purchasing Data Analyst is a well-organized individual who pays close attention to detail, and has a thorough understanding of numerical analysis, as well as database management. The purchasing Data Analyst is a key member of Sunrise Farms corporate purchasing team, providing a variety of non-poultry related velocity reports by supplier and by sku(s) in order to help maximize cost efficiencies. This person is a gatekeeper, entering and monitoring contract pricing in the company Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software and works very closely with the Corporate DIrector of Purchasing.




Responsibilities:




Oversee the day-to-day responsibilities of Syspro database management
Gatekeeper of contract pricing, including unit of measures (UOM) information, etc
Provides velocity reports and analysis - su;;lier volumes, sku volumes, COGS analysis (poultry NIC)
Participates in the preparation and overall review of issuing Requests For Proposals (RFPs)
Liaises with and supports buyers at the plant level
Monitor Purchase Orders (POs) and contract pricing compliance and training
Looks for opportunities and inventory management improvements
Looks for distribution and logistics improvement for purchases into plants
Develop SKU forecast based on historical sales and recent trends
Participate in local and company-wide process improvement initiatives
Other responsibilities as required





Requirements:




1-3 years of data anlytics experience
Post secondary education or equivilent
Strong planning and organizational skills
Strong financial and budgeting knowledge
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Ability to analyze data for effective decision-making
Strong working knowledge of Excel, Word, and database software


#IND2




At Sunrise Farms we are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

UNFI Canada is the leading distributor of natural, organic, and specialty foods in North America! We transform the world of food for our associates, customers, and the families we serve everyday! Our mission is simple: to provide healthier food choices to people everywhere.

Better Food, Better Future!

If YOU Are An Aspiring Data Analyst Professional Who

Enjoys building reports
Producing and providing analytical insights
AND loves food as much as we do!

This opportunity at UNFI may be right for you. Read on!

Position: Data Reporting Analyst

Job Type: Full Time Permanent

Schedule: Monday-Friday

Language Requirements: English

Working Conditions: Hybrid

Location: Richmond, B.C.

Purpose

Ensures that both External and Internal reports are issued in a timely manner. Ensures vendor reporting is charged to vendors as it is a source of income for the company.

Job Responsibilities

Responsible for generating and issuing Internal Reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis.
Responsible for generating and issuing Vendor Reports on a weekly and monthly basis.
Generates reporting using internal systems to effectively capture data needed for reporting including creating and running standard reports and ad-hoc reports.
Liaisies with Vendors and brokers to ensure trade and portfolio details are reported accordingly
Keeps track of Vendor Tiers and associated charges
Responsible for taking Vendor Feedback (from meetings or correspondence) to continually improve Vendor Reporting Platform
Responsible for addressing Vendor concerns either by email, or through interactive meetings (Virtual or in person)
Responsible for billings of Vendor Reports to ensure profit is generated.
Collaborates with cross-functional team members to understand, review, and solve outstanding data needs.
Actively listens to internal and external customer needs, prioritizes tasks, efficiently troubleshoots problems, and recommends solutions in a timely
Proactively seeks out pertinent data and conceives new and better ways of reporting and presenting information drawn from the various data sets.
Maintains data sources and systems for reporting purposes, job tools, and other data-related tasks.
Assists on new Reporting creation and launches to the organization (Power BI and others).
Documents Processes/Procedures.
Effectively manages priorities to ensure on-time delivery of accountabilities.
Performs other relevant job duties as required.

Qualifications

Education/Certification:

Bachelor's degree in Diploma, Mathematics, Science or Engineering

Experience

Previous experience in reporting analytics for a large organization preferred
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, and others)
Developing Workflows and process documentation

Knowledge

Advanced working knowledge of Excel
Proficiency in Power BI preferred
Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Powerpoint, and other computer applications
Familiarity of data analysis and ETL process skills and concepts including data modeling and transformations

Skills & Abilities

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Able to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a diverse community
Able to work independently and be self-directed in completing tasks assigned.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Able to multitask and prioritize

Reasons To Apply. Reasons To Stay At UNFI Canada

Competitive salary offered
Health and Dental benefits offered on your first day!
Paid vacation and sick days!
Retirement Savings Plan offered with employer-matching contributions after 6 months of service!
Employee discount on organic foods!
Friendly and helpful team!
Career advancement opportunities
And last, but not least, the opportunity to join a meaningful company that does meaningful work. Join us in our mission to provide healthier food choices for all! #BetterFood #BetterFuture!

Our Commitment

UNFI believes in a diverse and accommodating workplace. UNFI encourages and promotes applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of gender, age, race, ethnicity, disability or otherwise. UNFI is committed to providing full accommodation for persons with disabilities in all active processes and procedures including but not limited to the recruitment process. To request any accommodation you may require to participate in the recruitment process (including alternative formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please contact the main recruiting contact for the position or Human Resources to discuss your specific needs.

Additional Information

Company Name: UNFI Canada Inc.
Schedule: Full-time

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for designing and maintaining critical business intelligence metrics in support of the National Shipbuilding Strategy and the Canadian Coast Guard and Royal Canadian Navy vessel construction projects underway at the Seaspan Vancouver Shipyards.

This position focuses on enhancing the accessibility of and business value derived from key organizational data. This includes both development of new analytics, and support of analytics users throughout the business as well as the development of innovative new methods of collecting, analyzing, presenting, or actioning data.

Note: Due to business needs, this position is required to be fully on-site based at 2 Pemberton Avenue in North Vancouver.

Duties & Accountabilities

Validate data sources, transformations, and analysis against reference data to ensure quality, accuracy, and completeness of derived reports.
Complete data discovery and mapping of shipyard enterprise applications.
Develops documentation of business requirements, data sources, infrastructure, and reports to provide clarity and context for data consumers throughout the shipyard.
Develop dataflows and datasets using Power Query, M, DAX & SQL
Build dataset requirements, metrics, data/report definitions and establishes reporting governance processes.
Optimizes and standardizes all stages of the data analysis process, from extraction through to modelling & visualization.
Collects, validates, interprets, and organizes various types of data into relevant metrics and reports and/or summaries for designated business objectives.
Supports ad hoc and other unplanned analysis and reporting needs as determined by management priority and business changes.
Collaborates with and provides training and knowledge transfer to business end-users of reports and data sources.
Coordinates with Functional Department and Program Resources to define, collect and report departmental, program and shipyards level metrics.
Acts as a Business Intelligence Subject Matter Expert (SME) by supporting team members in the use and interpretation of data and understanding of metrics and reporting requirements.
Understanding business objectives and providing ad hoc data extracts by working with business partners
Effectively use the main data sources for reporting purposes within the business unit and maintain expert knowledge of all of these data sources


Education And Experience

Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business or a relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and/or work experience will be considered
Minimum 7 years of experience with business analytics, statistical analytics, KPI development and metrics reporting, preferably in a Program & Project Management environment with quantitative, financial or metric analysis on multiple large-scale data warehouses.
Experience with ground-up / full stack analytics solutions is an asset, including development of data sources, loading/transformation, analysis/modelling, reporting, and end user experiences.


Skills, Knowledge And Required Competencies

Well developed understanding of database structure, business object models, and large-scale data processing techniques.
Significant experience with Microsoft Power Query, M, DAX & SQL
Proven experience working with data and databases, including working experience with programming languages and business intelligence tools such as SQL and Power BI, to build dataflows, datasets and analytical solutions and create visual insights and dashboards
Familiarity and understanding of KPI analysis, performance measurement, financial systems and project scheduling/controls systems
Demonstrated data analytic skills including demonstrable ability to merge multiple data sources into substantial information, review incomplete data, problem solve to fill in gaps and provide recommendation for meaningful solutions
Deep technical communication ability, including the ability to clearly and concisely document and communicate complex data structures and process maps.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills for optimally communication
Well-developed organizational skills, including ability to prioritize a variety of work assignments
Experience with Azure Analytics Services, including Azure Analysis Services, is an asset.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and outstanding time management skills.
Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power Automate (Flow) is an asset


Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

  • Experience with Azure Analytics Services, including Azure Analysis Services, is an asset.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and outstanding time management skills.
  • Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power Automate (Flow) is an asset

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease.

We are seeking a motivated and dynamic Business Intelligence Specialist to join our Strategic Finance team, where you will work closely with a highly proficient team of business leaders, financial analysts, data scientists, project managers, and other stakeholders from across the organization to define and design technical solutions that address our corporate data analytics needs. If successful, you will be a key member of the team supporting and improving internal business processes through managing and analyzing enterprise data; and reporting on crucial business information and KPIs. This role is specifically responsible for developing impactful standardized reports, and dashboards, as well as ensuring effective self-service access to critical information for individuals about business KPIs. If you are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy the opportunities and challenges presented in a quickly evolving and dynamic work environment, and are energized at the thought of being part of a change for good, then we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

How you might spend your days:

Partnering with Business Analysts, Project Managers, and business unit leaders to design, develop and maintain business intelligence solutions
Leading the project lifecycle of crucial data analytics programs, from exploration through to development and execution; demonstrating project management skills that drive impact in a fast-paced environment
Working directly with business stakeholders and translating business data needs into business and technical requirements.
Developing, running, validating and reviewing reports, analyzing usage trends, and monitoring and maximizing operational excellence to ensure the delivery of analysis and reports in the most effective way possible for the target audience
Utilizing UI/UX best practices to craft visualizations that create a single, aligned version of the truth, presenting clear information about business results and call for action.
Assessing the impact to reports due to process changes and improvements
Getting curious about what is possible and exploring techniques, data and unique new ideas that drive business insights and facilitate decision-making.


We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you have:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Business Administration.
At least 5+ years of hands-on experience developing BI solutions, preferably with Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx, etc.
Pertinent experience in Data Modelling and a solid understanding of ETL methodologies paired with strong knowledge and proficiency in relational databases and SQL
Understanding of design and development tools, SDLC methodologies and techniques, and data storytelling and visualization.
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills ‚Äì proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems, ability to ask the right questions and propose solutions that enable the transformation of data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to build constructive relationships across a diverse set of stakeholders and gain the trust of others in a cross-functional environment.
Excellent documentation, organization, and communication skills.
Competency in Microsoft and Google Workspace applications.
Familiarity with or previous experience in the biotechnology industry is a bonus.


Offers & benefits:

The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefits
A minimum of 3 weeks‚Äô vacation
Opportunities for personal and professional development


About AbCellera:

At AbCellera, we find the next generation of therapeutic antibodies. To succeed, we create innovative solutions - combining custom antigen preparation and immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation - leaving no stone unturned, revolutionizing how scientists can explore natural antibody diversity and the scale at which they can do it. You‚Äôll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.

We‚Äôre a rapidly growing publicly traded company, and we have state-of-the-art discovery tools and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn‚Äôt just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of innovators working together to solve the toughest problems. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We‚Äôre looking for someone like you to support and organize our efforts along the way.

To apply:

Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 220128 in your cover letter. We apologize in advance, but we receive a large volume of applications and are only able to contact those who are selected for an interview.
