Title: Data Warehouse Specialist
Description:
Data Warehouse Analyst (12 Month Contract)

Location: New Westminster, BC / Hybrid

Staffing Placement Opportunity




Project Description:

The Daily Operations Management System (DOMS) is the primary tool to manage $250M a year in operator wages and provide an integrated operations and workforce

management system for managing the day-to-day activities for conventional bus operations. The software product currently supporting DOMS, called Bid-Dispatch (BD)

has been slated for retirement.




Services:

Reporting to the DPRP Technical Project Manager and working closely with Business Technology Services (BTS) Division and various other stakeholder

groups at the company.




The main areas of focus for the Senior data warehouse analysts (ETL developers) will be the design and implementation of a new data mart in Microsoft Azure Data Factory to

support BI reporting needs using data from the HASTUS application via web services and legacy on-prem application via SQL database.

Senior data warehouse analysts will have significant, full life-cycle experience with BI projects, Data Analytics, Data Pipelines, Data Modeling, Microsoft Azure and BI

technologies.




Specific services to be provided include (but are not limited to) the following:

‚Ä¢ Designs, develops, deploys, and tests end-to-end data pipelines and data models involving diverse systems/technologies including but not limited to Rest services, Azure Data Factory (ADF), Azure Databricks, Delta Lake, and Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Blob storage, Azure Synapse, and Azure Databricks

‚Ä¢ Design and build data models using Star Schema

‚Ä¢ Develops specifications for data archiving and recovery

‚Ä¢ Designing and documenting data cubes and dimensions

‚Ä¢ Develop Power BI reports

‚Ä¢ Resolve semantic discrepancies in data definitions that could arise among multiple sources (e.g., company business areas) by engaging Information Governance Committee (IGC)

‚Ä¢ Gain consensus among users on common business data definitions

‚Ä¢ Work with the stakeholder groups and project team to elaborate and decompose project objectives into a clear scope definition

‚Ä¢ Lead discussions with stakeholder groups to elicit and analyze requirements using a variety of techniques including interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, use cases/scenarios, and workflow analysis

‚Ä¢ Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts and

decompose high-level information into specifications.

‚Ä¢ Document detailed design and business decision using company standard project methodology.

‚Ä¢ Coordinate requirements walk-throughs and sign-offs with business stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Work with the project team, internal staff, and business stakeholders to document current as-is business processes and challenges, using standard business process notation and diagramming methods.

‚Ä¢ Support development and testing team members with clarification of the BI/DW design.




Deliverables:

Standard software development deliverables and supporting documentation will be expected.

These may include, but are not limited to, the following:

‚Ä¢ End-to-end data pipeline in ADF

‚Ä¢ Data models in ADF

‚Ä¢ Data migration to ADF

‚Ä¢ Power BI Reports

‚Ä¢ Design Specification Documents

‚Ä¢ Use Cases

‚Ä¢ Current state analysis and as-is data maps

‚Ä¢ Future state analysis and to-be data maps

‚Ä¢ Data flow architecture documents

‚Ä¢ Risk Analysis

‚Ä¢ Assistance with Standard Operating Procedures (for future state).

‚Ä¢ Assistance with User Acceptance Test (UAT) documents

‚Ä¢ Other documents produced through the related project activities listed above.




Knowledge & Experience:

To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:

‚Ä¢ Minimum of ten (10) years‚Äô experience with Business Intelligence (or related)

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with Spark (PySpark/Python) in Azure

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with a range of Azure Services, including ADF, Azure Databricks, Delta Lake, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Synapse, Power BI Report and Crystal Report

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with authoring Power BI reports, exposure to Power BI Cloud

‚Ä¢ Experience with data migration from on-prem to cloud (preferably Azure Data Factory)

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge and experience designing Data Lakes and Data Warehouses

‚Ä¢ Experience designing, building, and maintaining ETL/ELT data pipelines, (preferably Azure Data Factory)

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of Azure data ecosystem for compute and storage

‚Ä¢ Hands on experience with developing BI reports with Power BI

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, supervisors, subject matter experts and end users.

‚Ä¢ Skilled at facilitating and managing consultation processes with a wide range of stakeholder groups

‚Ä¢ Proven experience with gathering and analyzing functional and technical requirements and information from key business areas and stakeholder groups

‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills combined with highly developed communication skills, both verbal and written, are a must.

‚Ä¢ Ability to negotiate and influence, multi-task, analyze and improve processes.




Other desirable knowledge, skills, and abilities are listed below:

‚Ä¢ Hands-on knowledge of Azure SQL Data Warehouse architecture and best practices

‚Ä¢ Extensive knowledge of Dimensional Modelling and Kimball EDW principles Understanding of Azure Managed Instance

‚Ä¢ Experience working with Data Lakes and Data Marts

‚Ä¢ Ability to work with large volumes of data from multiple sources

‚Ä¢ Microsoft SQL Server SSIS/SSRS/ETL

‚Ä¢ Experience in Azure IaaS, PaaS and Database migration

‚Ä¢ Experience working with external vendors.

‚Ä¢ Experience working in a unionized environment

HTML:
Data Warehouse Analyst (12 Month Contract)

Location: New Westminster, BC / Hybrid

Staffing Placement Opportunity


Project Description:

The Daily Operations Management System (DOMS) is the primary tool to manage $250M a year in operator wages and provide an integrated operations and workforce

management system for managing the day-to-day activities for conventional bus operations. The software product currently supporting DOMS, called Bid-Dispatch (BD)

has been slated for retirement.


Services:

Reporting to the DPRP Technical Project Manager and working closely with Business Technology Services (BTS) Division and various other stakeholder

groups at the company.


The main areas of focus for the Senior data warehouse analysts (ETL developers) will be the design and implementation of a new data mart in Microsoft Azure Data Factory to

support BI reporting needs using data from the HASTUS application via web services and legacy on-prem application via SQL database.

Senior data warehouse analysts will have significant, full life-cycle experience with BI projects, Data Analytics, Data Pipelines, Data Modeling, Microsoft Azure and BI

technologies.


Specific services to be provided include (but are not limited to) the following:

‚Ä¢ Designs, develops, deploys, and tests end-to-end data pipelines and data models involving diverse systems/technologies including but not limited to Rest services, Azure Data Factory (ADF), Azure Databricks, Delta Lake, and Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Blob storage, Azure Synapse, and Azure Databricks

‚Ä¢ Design and build data models using Star Schema

‚Ä¢ Develops specifications for data archiving and recovery

‚Ä¢ Designing and documenting data cubes and dimensions

‚Ä¢ Develop Power BI reports

‚Ä¢ Resolve semantic discrepancies in data definitions that could arise among multiple sources (e.g., company business areas) by engaging Information Governance Committee (IGC)

‚Ä¢ Gain consensus among users on common business data definitions

‚Ä¢ Work with the stakeholder groups and project team to elaborate and decompose project objectives into a clear scope definition

‚Ä¢ Lead discussions with stakeholder groups to elicit and analyze requirements using a variety of techniques including interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, use cases/scenarios, and workflow analysis

‚Ä¢ Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts and

decompose high-level information into specifications.

‚Ä¢ Document detailed design and business decision using company standard project methodology.

‚Ä¢ Coordinate requirements walk-throughs and sign-offs with business stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Work with the project team, internal staff, and business stakeholders to document current as-is business processes and challenges, using standard business process notation and diagramming methods.

‚Ä¢ Support development and testing team members with clarification of the BI/DW design.


Deliverables:

Standard software development deliverables and supporting documentation will be expected.

These may include, but are not limited to, the following:

‚Ä¢ End-to-end data pipeline in ADF

‚Ä¢ Data models in ADF

‚Ä¢ Data migration to ADF

‚Ä¢ Power BI Reports

‚Ä¢ Design Specification Documents

‚Ä¢ Use Cases

‚Ä¢ Current state analysis and as-is data maps

‚Ä¢ Future state analysis and to-be data maps

‚Ä¢ Data flow architecture documents

‚Ä¢ Risk Analysis

‚Ä¢ Assistance with Standard Operating Procedures (for future state).

‚Ä¢ Assistance with User Acceptance Test (UAT) documents

‚Ä¢ Other documents produced through the related project activities listed above.


Knowledge & Experience:

To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:

‚Ä¢ Minimum of ten (10) years‚Äô experience with Business Intelligence (or related)

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with Spark (PySpark/Python) in Azure

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with a range of Azure Services, including ADF, Azure Databricks, Delta Lake, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Synapse, Power BI Report and Crystal Report

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with authoring Power BI reports, exposure to Power BI Cloud

‚Ä¢ Experience with data migration from on-prem to cloud (preferably Azure Data Factory)

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge and experience designing Data Lakes and Data Warehouses

‚Ä¢ Experience designing, building, and maintaining ETL/ELT data pipelines, (preferably Azure Data Factory)

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of Azure data ecosystem for compute and storage

‚Ä¢ Hands on experience with developing BI reports with Power BI

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, supervisors, subject matter experts and end users.

‚Ä¢ Skilled at facilitating and managing consultation processes with a wide range of stakeholder groups

‚Ä¢ Proven experience with gathering and analyzing functional and technical requirements and information from key business areas and stakeholder groups

‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills combined with highly developed communication skills, both verbal and written, are a must.

‚Ä¢ Ability to negotiate and influence, multi-task, analyze and improve processes.


Other desirable knowledge, skills, and abilities are listed below:

‚Ä¢ Hands-on knowledge of Azure SQL Data Warehouse architecture and best practices

‚Ä¢ Extensive knowledge of Dimensional Modelling and Kimball EDW principles Understanding of Azure Managed Instance

‚Ä¢ Experience working with Data Lakes and Data Marts

‚Ä¢ Ability to work with large volumes of data from multiple sources

‚Ä¢ Microsoft SQL Server SSIS/SSRS/ETL

‚Ä¢ Experience in Azure IaaS, PaaS and Database migration

‚Ä¢ Experience working with external vendors.

‚Ä¢ Experience working in a unionized environment

Title: Data Warehouse Developer
Description:
This job was posted on our former career site as Posting #177677




Come work as a Data Engineer with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!




Reporting to the Director and operating within the context of a client service culture to provide organizational leadership with respect to information management and analysis, quality measurement and evaluation and utilization strategies, the Data Engineer identifies, develops, implements and maintains an innovative response to the quality, utilization and other information needs of Vancouver Coastal Health. Responsibilities include consultation services, detailed analysis of information including confidential data files; user needs assessment and requirements surveys; integrated report design; development of appropriate database structures and development of dashboards, key performance indicators and balanced scorecards.




As a Data Engineer with Vancouver Coastal Health you will




Develop and establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, validation and implementation
Collaborate with a variety of cross-functional team members to identify, develop, implement and maintain innovative solutions for the information needs of Vancouver Coastal Health.
Apply experience in data modelling, data warehousing, building data pipelines, and excellent problem solving ability to tackle processing of high volumes of clinical data




Education & Experience




Master‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Information Systems or equivalent industry/certification experience
Three (3) years experience in Information, Utilization Management and Quality Management.




Knowledge & Abilities




Working knowledge using cloud data warehousing solutions (e.g. Azure SQL, Synapse Analytics, Databricks, etc.)
Preferred knowledge of Azure or other cloud infrastructure services
Demonstrated experience building and optimizing data pipelines (ETL) using SSIS, Azure Data Factory
Preferred experience with Azure DevOps
Preferred proficiency coding in Python, Scala, R, Java
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of database design and report design at the intermediate to advanced level.
Knowledge of healthcare databases an asset.




As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.




WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?




VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve, and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.




Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff




Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.




We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.




Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2023.




Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.




***Employees of VCH must apply online via the Internal Career Portal on CareerHub, you are currently viewing the External Career Portal. Refer to the https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for instructions on how to view internal job postings and how to apply as an employee. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***




Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Title: Senior Data Management Analyst (Metadata)
Description:
Job Description Summary

STEMCELL, Canada‚Äôs largest biotech company is looking for an experienced metadata management professional. The Metadata Management Lead design, implement, and support metadata management solutions to collect, structure, and deliver information on data in technical and business contexts.

As the Metadata Management Lead you will champion building and maintaining an effective metadata management practice at STEMCELL, creating a metadata repository, establishing a metadata management process, and implementing metadata management software.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities


Lead the adoption of metadata management software and practice, design and implement improvements of metadata repository, metadata management process, and workflow
Work with data owners in developing data-related business rules, terms, and definitions and maintain this metadata to keep it up to date reviews metadata artifacts, and make recommendations on their improvements
Design data management processes and procedures, their roles and responsibilities, and define metrics to demonstrate the metadata management efficiency and its impact on business outcomes
Configure metadata management software and work with IT to enhance it or resolve any issues, as well as ensure related Helpdesk tickets are resolved in a timely manner
Lead and execute operational metadata management duties to monitor and control the metadata management process, and maintain documentation and training materials


Knowledge And Qualifications


Bachelor's degree with 10+ years of relevant experience
Has a deep understanding of Metadata Management methodologies and best practices
Required experience with Metadata Management, Data Governance, and data catalogs
Must have experience in the implementation of metadata management software
Desirable leadership experience in delivering data management solutions (e.g. Metadata, Master Data Management, or Data Quality)


#united

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as ‚ÄúScientists Helping Scientists‚Äù ‚Äì standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative, and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and meaningful career development opportunities.

STEMCELL is well recognized for exceptional leadership and business practices. We are one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies and operate an ISO 14001-certified environmental management system to measure and reduce our environmental impact.

As an equal opportunity employer, STEMCELL is dedicated to ensuring that every employee feels safe, valued, and respected for who they are. We know that scientific progress and innovation occur when diverse, creative minds come together and we are committed to nurturing a culture of inclusivity and belonging. STEMCELL enforces a zero-tolerance policy for any form of discrimination. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

NOTE: STEMCELL‚Äôs vaccination policy requires that all candidates for this role be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including boosters), as currently recommended or required by local health authorities and public health orders, unless an exemption from this policy is approved through our accommodation request process.

To apply, please select the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button below. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account, which is required to apply.

Title: Senior Analytics Specialist
Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated, innovative, experienced customer-focused analyst, with a keen interest in strategic analysis, data-science, and performance measurement and evaluation to join our Business Intelligence and Analytics (BIA) team which has been rated as one of the best in the Canadian public sector.

In this role, you'll contribute to the effectiveness of WorkSafeBC by providing strategic analysis, advanced analytics, and business intelligence to support business decision making.

If you're a team player, proactive, and a strong communicator with sound problem solving and critical thinking skills, then consider joining us for a rewarding career keeping the population of British Columbia safe. We'd like to hear from you!

As a senior analytics specialist on our BIA team you will:

Conduct data analytics, performance measurement analysis, and program evaluation addressing a wide variety of issues in occupational health and safety, management oversight, internal operations, and disability management
Identify trends, emerging issues, drivers, and opportunities of business significance to WorkSafeBC, and developing recommendations to management and senior management related to those areas
Develop/improve data models for forecasting/prediction, targeting, outlier detection, and performance measurement to successfully convey key themes and messages
Facilitate inter-departmental and inter-organizational sessions focused on performance improvement, opportunity identification, and problem solving, leveraging data to meet business objectives
Lead various internal teams on ad-hoc requests, investigations, pilot studies, proofs of concept, and various program evaluation projects

We're Looking For Someone Who Can

Independently plan, prioritize, schedule, and complete complex multi-task workload of projects and activities to consistently meet deadlines
Gather information; summarize, verify and interpret data; assimilate technical and business information; and review relevant information with clients, co-workers, and contacts
Clearly and concisely present analysis results and recommendations both in written reports and verbally to individuals and groups of varying levels of expertise
Identify significant information from a variety of sources, collect and analyze data to develop, assess, and establish meaningful ways of grouping and transforming data to draw conclusions of underlying issues
Apply quantitative and qualitative research methods (e.g. statistical analyses, data modeling, text mining, machine learning, predictive analytics, sampling, survey and questionnaire design).
Your experience and educational background:

A master's degree in a quantitative-related discipline such as statistics/mathematics, operations research, big data, data science, computer science, information technology, finance, business, management information systems, or engineering.
A minimum of three years of directly related experience in business intelligence, statistical analysis, strategic analysis, and/or advanced analytics.
Application Requirements:

You will be required to successfully meet WorkSafeBC's requirements with regards to a criminal record clearance.

If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) at the time you submit your application.

Who are we?

At WorkSafeBC, we're dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers compensation system for today and future generations. We're honoured to serve the 2.4 million workers and 245,000 registered employers in our province.

WorkSafeBC's COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the "Policy") is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect.

We recognize that our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences, and which reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?

It's challenging, stimulating and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.

Our Benefits

Being part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes vacation, optional leave arrangements, health care and dental benefits, and contributions toward your retirement pension. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work ‚Äî and life.

Learn More About What We Offer .

You will be required to successfully meet WorkSafeBC's requirements with regards to a criminal record clearance.

WorkSafeBC is an inclusive and accessible employer committed to employment equity objectives and invites applications from all qualified individuals. Only those under consideration will be contacted. If you're unsuccessful, please accept our appreciation for your interest.

We've adopted a hybrid model offering opportunities to work remotely within BC and onsite based on the operational needs of the position.

Title: AWS Data Engineer
Description:
ProCogia is a data consulting firm headquartered in Vancouver, BC with employees and clients across the United States and Canada. We specialize in Data Operations, Data Engineering, BI & Analytics, Data Science & Bioinformatics across a broad range of industries including Telecom, Pharma, Biotechnology, Retail, Logistics, Technology, Financial Services, Media & non-profit. We are a technology-agnostic firm giving us a client-first, independent approach towards delivering our Data solutions.

We‚Äôre a diverse, close-knit team with a common pursuit of providing top-class, end-to-end data solutions for our clients. In return for your talent and technical expertise, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary, generous benefits along with ample opportunity for personal development. ‚ÄòGrowth mindset‚Äô is something we seek in all our new hires and has helped drive much of our recent growth across North America. Our distinct approach is to push the limits and value derived from data. Working within ProCogia‚Äôs thriving environment will allow you to unleash your full career potential.

ProCogia has experienced considerable growth over the last two years & core to our culture is maintaining a high-level of gender equality throughout the company. Our diversity and differences allow us to create innovative and effective data solutions for our clients.

Our Mission

We enable our customers to make intelligent and agile decisions through strategically tailored data solutions. We attract, develop and retain diverse, motivated and collaborative team players who love what they do.

Our Values

TRUST We build trust in all of our relationships, internally and externally

GROWTH We believe in life-long learning; both personally and professionally

INNOVATION Our technology-agnostic & innovative approach enables cutting-edge data solutions

EXCELLENCE We are committed to delivering excellence in everything we do

ProCogia Overview

At ProCogia we‚Äôre passionate about developing data-driven solutions that provide highly informed answers to our clients‚Äô most critical challenges. Our projects are varied, from Data Warehouse builds, deploying Cloud Data Solutions, Dashboarding, & building predictive models.

We work with industry leading clients from various sectors including Pharmaceuticals, Telecommunications, Technology, Financial Services & Retail. Our work environment ensures opportunities to gain valuable experience in various industries enhancing your personal & career development.

ProCogia has doubled in size over the last two years & core to ProCogia‚Äôs culture is ensuring we maintain a balanced gender ratio. Our diversity, and differences allow us to create innovative and effective solutions for our clients.

Job Description

The Data Engineer Consultant has the following responsibilities and duties:

Be a member of the technical staff building solutions for the business.
Design, implementation, testing, debugging, performance tuning, documentation, validation, and support of analytical solutions
Translate business requirements into analytical solutions.
Analyze, model and wrangle data and files to prep for utilization.
Build data pipelines to move data into S3 and Redshift


Requirements

The Data Engineer Consultant should have the following skills, educa,tion and experience:

Skills

Required:


Excellent SQL and Python skills
Experience with distributed computing languages (Spark, PySpark, Scala, SparklyR, etc)
ETL/ELT hands-on experience with familiarity of Data Warehouse concepts
Expertise in designing efficient Data Models
Experience with Data Warehousing (Redshift, Snowflake, etc.)
Knowledge of AWS services like EC2, EMR, Lambda, Glue, Athena, Kinesis Data Streams, Kinesis Firehose, etc.
Knowledge of API-based integration and security (Restful and SOAP)
Knowledge of IAM roles, Policies, etc.
Experience in Data Visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI etc.
Ability to learn fast and translate data into actionable results.
Excellent written and communication skills.


Preferred:


Experience developing and supporting scalable data pipelines
Experience building cloud formation templates for workloads
Familiar with EKS and ECS AWS services
Solid Linux programming skills
Experience building Data Platforms, Data lakes and Business Intelligence solutions.


Education

Required:


Bachelors in computer science, engineering, information technology or other related disciplines.


Preferred:


Masters or PhD in computer science, engineering, information technology or other related disciplines.


Experience


An experienced professional will have at least 3 years of professional experience in a data related role with a Masters Degree or 5 years of experience in a data related role with a Bachelors degree


ProCogia is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workspace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description:

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a permanent, full-time Senior Data Engineer in the Innovation and Technology Group. Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, the successful candidate will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The Data Engineer will support the digital transformation team, Datahub architecture and data scientists on data initiatives. The right candidate will be excited to join a fast paced, dynamic team and be part of re-designing the company‚Äôs architecture to support the digital transformation journey and the development of the advanced analytics capability.

Responsibilities:

Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure cloud services.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights to enhance customer experience and increase operational efficiencies.
Develop processes and documentation for data collection and integration
Collaborate and create data tools for advanced analytics and data science team members that assist in building and optimizing our digital products and machine learning models.
Create, maintain, and enhance dashboards and other visualizations for stakeholders.
Work with stakeholders at all levels to assist with data related technical issues and support data infrastructure needs.
Collaborate with the Information Security team on securing the data sources.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements; by automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, and ensuring the data infrastructure is scalable.
Establish methods and procedures for tracking data quality, completeness, redundancy, and improvement
Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

Experience:

At least 7 years‚Äô post degree experience designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-data architecture and environments for medium to large sized organizations, plus at least 5 years of advanced analytics and project management experience (senior level)
A bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Management, or a related field; or an equivalent combination of training and experience
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases.
A strong background in technology with experience in data engineering, data warehouse development, or software development looking to move into the big data environment.
Working experience with Azure, Databricks, Denodo, Snowflakes and Qlik would be preferred.
Experience with data integration using APIs
Computer programming skills, R, Python, Java, JSON, HTML, SQL
Strong project management skills, using waterfall and agile methodologies.
Excellent documentation skills, including workflow documentation

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer-Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics and Reporting, the BI Developer-Analyst is responsible for developing and maintaining BI solutions, including Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), reports, dashboards, and analytical solutions to support effective use of data by PHC clinical and non-clinical programs, Senior Leadership Team (SLT) and other key partners. Responsibilities include dashboard development, database development and monitoring, data modeling, data dictionary development and maintenance, application development, documentation, maintenance of users and user permission, performing routine periodic processing activities related to key decision support applications, participating in the design, writing, production, and documentation of standard and ad hoc queries and reports, problem identification, analyzing healthcare data and communicating the findings through the use of data visualization and storytelling. The BI Developer-Analyst works closely with colleagues to audit, identify and follow-up on issues related to data quality, metric definitions or process deficiencies. The BI Developer-Analyst acts as a key interface between Data Analytics Leads, Solutions Architect and the Data Analytics (Decision Support) teams at our partner organizations, as well as the Information Management, Information Technology (IM/IT) departments to ensure the solutions meet the business requirements and the technical specifications and adhere to team standards. This role requires a strong foundation in analytical methods, data warehousing, data visualization and statistics. The position requires access to detailed and confidential information of all types (clinical, financial, payroll, etc.).



¬†



Designs, develops and maintains dashboards, databases, ETL, reports and other BI content and analytical solutions as required. Works collaboratively with clients and business analysts to gather requirements, create definitions and specifications and translate into data models, ETL packages and reports as appropriate. Writes ad-hoc queries and reports to support analysts and leaders in data analysis.
Participates in the VCH/PHC regional and PHC local Data Warehouse development lifecycle including: planning, development, testing, migration and production support development activities.
Design, develop and support all extraction and integration processes (ETL).
Design and build interactive and static data visualizations to provide insights.
Liaise with team members and/or other partners to determine analytical solutions requirements including understanding inefficiencies in existing business applications and future business needs.
Extract, manipulate and analyze complex information from multiple data sources / systems using a variety of software (e.g., R, SQL, Python)
Conduct statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to improve forecasting, targeting and performance measurement
Assist with data-related technical challenges and perform root-cause analysis to answer specific business questions and recommend and implementing ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality.
Maintain a repository of metadata and lineage information about how data flows through its lifecycle.
Contribute to the development and documentation of data management standards framework.
In consultation with the Solutions Architect, provides input into the logical design and development of PHC Local Data Warehouse data models to be used for reporting and information delivery.
Collaborates with Database Administrators, Systems Analysts, and Solutions Architect to identify, analyze and rationalize internal and external data sources and ETL strategies.
Performs technical analysis and prepares and implements recommended ETL design approach.
Prepares and validates end-to-end business logic and mappings.
Develops, tests, documents and implements proposed analytical solutions (e.g., reports and dashboards).
Responds to ad-hoc, on-demand and scheduled business user information requests as they relate to services and support provided by the business groups.
Produces and maintains core PHC management reports, departmental dashboards and related management tools.
Adapts ETL processes as necessary to accommodate changes in source systems and target business user requirements.
Maintains and administers PHC organizational development key performance indicators data and reports.
Supports and maintains migration of data to data mart from source systems.
Develops, maintains and schedules ETL data flows/workflows/jobs, and provides daily support of these processes once implemented.
Works with business users to validate rules regarding data integrity and data quality as it relates to the impact on business needs.
Debugs, monitors and troubleshoots business solutions to resolve production issues.
Liaises with other IT Development and Operations departments to clarify and build applications that meet business unit objectives.
Administers security settings and access to the data mart and related systems.
Supports all business users with the use of data mart tools and in deployment activities such as user acceptance testing, user training, product demos and product evaluation.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Extract, manipulate and analyze complex information from multiple data sources / systems using a variety of software (e.g., R, SQL, Python)
Conduct statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to improve forecasting, targeting and performance measurement
Assist with data-related technical challenges and perform root-cause analysis to answer specific business questions and recommend and implementing ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality.
Maintain a repository of metadata and lineage information about how data flows through its lifecycle.
Contribute to the development and documentation of data management standards framework.
In consultation with the Solutions Architect, provides input into the logical design and development of PHC Local Data Warehouse data models to be used for reporting and information delivery.
Collaborates with Database Administrators, Systems Analysts, and Solutions Architect to identify, analyze and rationalize internal and external data sources and ETL strategies.
Performs technical analysis and prepares and implements recommended ETL design approach.
Prepares and validates end-to-end business logic and mappings.
Develops, tests, documents and implements proposed analytical solutions (e.g., reports and dashboards).
Responds to ad-hoc, on-demand and scheduled business user information requests as they relate to services and support provided by the business groups.
Produces and maintains core PHC management reports, departmental dashboards and related management tools.
Adapts ETL processes as necessary to accommodate changes in source systems and target business user requirements.
Maintains and administers PHC organizational development key performance indicators data and reports.
Supports and maintains migration of data to data mart from source systems.
Develops, maintains and schedules ETL data flows/workflows/jobs, and provides daily support of these processes once implemented.
Works with business users to validate rules regarding data integrity and data quality as it relates to the impact on business needs.
Debugs, monitors and troubleshoots business solutions to resolve production issues.
Liaises with other IT Development and Operations departments to clarify and build applications that meet business unit objectives.
Administers security settings and access to the data mart and related systems.
Supports all business users with the use of data mart tools and in deployment activities such as user acceptance testing, user training, product demos and product evaluation.
Performs other duties as assigned.

¬†



¬†



Education
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related field plus a minimum of five (5) years‚Äô recent, related experience with data modeling, data visualization and reporting tools (specifically, Tableau, SAP Crystal Reports, SSRS and Power BI), ETL, Microsoft BI tools (SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS), advanced T-SQL (Microsoft Transact SQL) and analyzing business requirements or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Significant recent experience is also required in the following:



business analysis and project management;
coordinating and documenting the change management process for complex information systems;
upgrading/migrating to SQL Server Platforms - SQL Server 2019;
writing T-SQL;
programming experience in C#, VB.net, Java, etc.



Skills and Abilities
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.
‚Ä¢ Expert proficiency in Tableau and other Analytical and Reporting tools. Strong analytical/modeling skills with the ability to convert raw data into actionable business insights.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated knowledge of OLAP technologies and dimensional modeling.
‚Ä¢ Strong background in data architecture, data quality, data mapping, and data structures.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of database and business intelligence concepts.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to interpret data files and record layouts to map fields between multiple systems and database tables.
‚Ä¢ Work effectively in an ETL framework driven environment with proven ability to prepare, maintain and publish ETL documentation, including source-to-target mappings and business-driven transformation rules.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of business processes and transactional systems within the business domain.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to understand and prioritize user and business requirements, and to conceptualize information processing solutions in response to them, including analyze, scope and define work effort required to correct program deficiencies and problems.
‚Ä¢ Strong interpersonal relationship management skills, a team player with a client/user orientation.
‚Ä¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas/processes in simple terminology to internal and external partners, including all levels of management.
‚Ä¢ Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards.
‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational skills with proven ability to plan and execute complex projects.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work to independently, meeting deadlines under pressure, with minimal supervision and frequent interruptions.
‚Ä¢ Ability to teach, coach and mentor others.
‚Ä¢ Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Business Systems Analyst in search of your next contract opportunity? Our high-profile client is seeking to hire a Business Systems Analyst to join their talented team on a 6 month contract with a strong probability of extension. Apply for this amazing opportunity if this sounds like a good fit for you!

Advantages

What‚Äôs in it for you!

As a Business Systems Analyst with our client, you‚Äôll receive:

Highly competitive market hourly rates
A 6 month contract with a strong probability of extension
Remote interview process


Responsibilities

Analyze technology systems and related processes to identify and design improvements.
Coordinate with engineering/systems team to develop the most cost-effective solution on complex, high-impact efforts.
Assemble resources and key decision makers from across the organization to deliver defined scope of work and support through go-live.
Understand business needs around Planning & demand forecasting and translate to functional and technical requirements.
Understand end-user interfaces and actions, and how a forecast supports those actions.
Defines minimum feature set, acceptance criteria, user acceptance tests.
Engages in design and impact assessments
Performs configuration of application components


Qualifications

5+ years in technology with recent experience in Data Science/Machine Learning
5+ years of agile and scrum team experience.
3+ years of retail industry experience with Demand Forecasting, Planning and Allocation systems.
Proficient at requirement gathering, managing ambiguity, and driving a project from inception to delivery.
Adept at interpreting Business requirements into technical requirements
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong cloud technology background: AWS preferred.
Strong communication skills: both verbal and written.
Knowledge of SQL scripts for analysis and reporting (Oracle /SQL server)
Experience in agile/enterprise tools such as Jira, Confluence, ServiceNow, Zoom, MS Teams.
Preferred Scrum certification: SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) is nice to have.


Summary

If you are a Business Systems Analyst and the prospect of joining a dedicated team intrigues you, then this role with our high-profile client could be the perfect opportunity for you.

Apply below or reach out to your Randstad representative for more information.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. Advantages

What‚Äôs in it for you!

  • A 6 month contract with a strong probability of extension

Title: Senior AI/ML Data Engineer - Data Platform Team
Description:
Join Unbounce and help shape the future of marketing.




We‚Äôre a people-first, customer-obsessed company motivated by our passion for empowering digital marketers to achieve success with their campaigns. With intuitive landing page builders and a comprehensive suite of AI-powered features, our




Our team's technical expertise and creativity work together to drive our mission forward every day. We aim to continue being an innovative and inspiring company that both our customers and employees admire‚Äîand we invite our future team members to join us!




About the team:




The Data Platform team is responsible for creating and maintaining the ecosystem upon which all of Unbounce‚Äôs data needs are built‚Äîthis includes data processing, data science, machine learning and data analysis. It is an integral team to Unbounce‚Äôs data-driven vision, with many opportunities to create high-impact platform solutions and collaborate with almost every part of the company.




What you‚Äôll be doing:
Designing and implementing platform solutions to solve modern data problems, such as:
Infrastructure to support all aspects of model training; data collection, categorisation and evaluation
Self-serve rapid prototyping, deployment, and evaluation of machine learning features for our ML Engineers and Data Scientists
Self-serve data discoverability and analysis for all Unbouncers (both technical and non-technical)
Secure, flexible and performant APIs with granular access controls for both internal and external clients
Data observability, governance and lineage
Event-based stream data architecture, using tooling such as Kafka
Orchestrated/batch-based data architecture, using tools such as Airflow
Working closely with our partners in Data Analytics, Data Science and Machine Learning, and the wider Engineering organization to refine requirements and deliver high-impact, customer-facing data solutions
Drive and participate in the creation and review of solution designs and architecture
Educate and provide guidance to the wider organization on industry best practices
Develop, improve and support infrastructure for existing data solutions on our warehouses and event streams




A little bit about you:




You have 5 to 10 years of experience in Data & Analytics
Strong communicator, skillful at raising strategic recommendations to leadership and business stakeholders that advance the business decision-making process through the use of enterprise-level analytical solutions
You excel at working with non-technical stakeholders to help translate, manage and drive business needs into actionable insights
Extensive experience with BI Tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
Proven experience building data models and advanced analytics solutions (predictive models, multivariate testing, statistical analysis)
Excellent SQL Skills ‚Äì you are comfortable working with complex datasets and writing efficient code to create effective data models
You build relationships across the organization to develop and maintain trust
You‚Äôre skillful at making strategy recommendations and working with senior management to identify problems, solutions, and insights to drive the business forward
Experience working in a SaaS/E-commerce environment
You‚Äôre experienced in project management: managing and prioritizing tasks across teams (we use agile ceremonies, and JIRA to track our work), knowing who to loop in when, and providing timely updates to your stakeholders
You‚Äôre familiar with 3rd party tooling and data integrations and with monitoring/maintaining data integrity across multiple systems
Familiar with data warehouse design, database management and distributed systems




We believe the ideal candidate will have experience in:




Designing and implementing platform solutions/infrastructure to solve common ML/data problems (such as supporting and running reproducible ML pipelines at scale), with proven experience of deploying these to production
Working closely with Machine Learning/Data Science experts, supporting them so that they can iterate and deliver value quickly
Designing secure APIs to serve our ML models and data capabilities to both internal and external clients, prioritizing usability, extensibility and performance
Using and building solutions around Machine Learning platforms and tooling, such as SageMaker and/or OpenAI
Building event-based stream architecture, using tooling such as Kafka
Building orchestrated/batch-based architecture, using tools such as Airflow
Working with a range of database types (SQL, NoSQL, Graph, etc.)
Working with any of the major cloud-based technologies and platforms ‚Äì AWS experience is a big bonus!
Deploying containerized applications, leveraging Docker and Kubernetes (or similar)
Writing Infrastructure as Code, using tools like CloudFormation or Terraform
Implementing observability and monitoring of systems and processes
Proficient with Linux-based environments and shell scripting




Share our values:




Courage
Ambition
Being Real
Empathy
Diversity




What's in it for you:




ü§ù Flexibility and time off




A digital-first, distributed working model with flexible hours ‚Äì for this role, we will consider all applications from those based in Canada*, with the option to work from our Vancouver office
20 vacation days
Holiday Closure: December 25th - January 1st
One paid day off on your birthday
One paid volunteer day per year




ü©∫ Health and wellness




A comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and generous mental health support options ‚Äì all available on day 1
12 personal wellness days
$500 health and wellness allowance**
Parental leave and planned reintegration program




üéì Growth




Org-wide and employee-led DEI and growth initiatives
Professional development time and budget




üåü More perks!




One-time work-from-home allowance - $500
An annual allowance of $1,000 that you can choose to use toward your vacation, or put toward your RRSP contribution**
Please note that we currently do not have a legal entity set up to operate as an employer of record in Quebec. We thank you for your consideration but we are unable to accept candidates from Quebec at this time.
These amounts will be prorated based on your start date.




Unbounce welcomes you to be YOU!




At Unbounce, we want every employee to be excited to bring their full, authentic self to work. When you bring your unique experiences, background, knowledge, perspective, and self-expression while embracing the same from others we learn from each other. We innovate and co-create an environment where Unbouncers can do the best work of their careers. We‚Äôre bolder and more brilliant together.




We‚Äôre dedicated to ensuring each Unbouncer feels a sense of belonging, feels safe, cared for, respected and valued for who they are, and trusts that their unique voice is heard, embraced, and meaningfully contributes to decision-making. We‚Äôre committed to equitable employee experience, opportunity, pay and support for every employee regardless of gender identity or expression, race, ethnicity, family or marital status, religion, socio-economic status, veteran status, national origin, age, sexual orientation, education, disability, or any other characteristic that makes you unique.




We have no tolerance for sexism, racism, xenophobia, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, ageism, or any other forms of hateful/harmful discrimination and we‚Äôre taking action against unequal pay in our community through leading the #PayUpforProgress movement.

Title: Analytics Specialist (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to know our team:




The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.




Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:




Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders




What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:




Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently




It‚Äôs great if you have:




Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.




We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

Title: Network Analyst, 6-months Term - (Hybrid/Remote)
Description:
Central 1 cooperatively empowers credit unions and other financial institutions to deliver banking choice to Canadians. Central 1 provides critical services at scale to enable a thriving credit union system. We do this by collaborating with our clients, developing strategies, products and services to support the financial well-being of their more than 5 million diverse customers in communities across Canada. For more information, visit www.central1.com.




What we offer:




Work-life flexibility
Hybrid work environment
One time allowance to set up your office for remote first employees
Variable annual incentive plan
Generous annual vacation allotment
Top-notch flexible benefits plan
Retirement Plan, matched contributions at 6%
Access to a learning platform and educational assistance support
Career development opportunities
Wellness Flex Fund to support personal interest and activities
Day off to volunteer in your community and other paid time off options
Corporate discounts

*subject to employment agreement




Job Summary:




We are seeking a highly skilled network analyst to join our team. Our network is highly complex and is the combination of a service provider and a traditional enterprise that supports credit unions across Canada. We are in the transformation stages of the traditional data center network to a hybrid model including Azure and AWS. If you are looking for a rewarding challenge, look no further. This role will be working with a great team of network analysts and having access to seasoned senior engineers to lean on.




The network analyst will be responsible for analyzing and monitoring network activity, identifying network issues, and implementing solutions to ensure the stability and performance of our network infrastructure.




What you'll be doing:




Developing, implementing and supporting a network environment consisting of data centers that are integrated into Azure and AWS.
Planning and testing rollout of new network hardware and system releases
Analyzing and monitoring network activity to identify issues and potential security risks.
Perform regular maintenance and updates to network hardware and software
Designing and implementing IT network systems of varying complexity
Script, automate, and test network routine network changes.
Performing considerably complex troubleshooting of network systems in collaboration with other teams.
Proactive involvement in incident resolution and root cause analysis.
Developing comprehensive operational procedures for on-going support and change management.
Capacity planning, process, and resource analyses of the network
Creating and maintaining documentation for existing and new network systems using detailed diagrams
Monitoring security forums and vendor mailing lists, ensuring all network systems are up to date with patches and not vulnerable to attacks.
Providing technical expertise to various project and product teams to implement standardized solutions.
Performing other duties as required to deliver exceptional service and to support Central 1‚Äôs business goals
Providing 24x7 on-call support in a customer-centric environment and resolving the more complex problems and interconnection issues with external service




What you'll have:




4+ years relevant experience in network support, preferably with related network certifications.
A CCNA or CCNP (preferred) certification is an asset.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills in complex environments
Experience within a large enterprise IT environment
Extensive experience with VPN IPSEC and TCP/IP
Strong Working knowledge of BGP and OSPF
Experience using command line to configure the network.
Experience with SD-WAN
Excellent communications skills and ability to effectively communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Network automation and scripting experience would be an asset




What we do:




Core Cisco routing and switching (802.1Q VLAN, QoS, HSRP, OSPF, BGP) configuration and support.
Firewall implementation, configuration, and support (Cisco ASA and Palo Alto)
Load balancing configuration and support (F5 Big IP)
Network traffic analysis and troubleshooting
Communication infrastructures, VPN (Global Protect), MPLS, etc.
Supporting a mixed Linux/Windows virtualized server environment.
Experience with AWS and/or Azure
Hands-on experience with network automation




Central 1 is an equal opportunity employer and committed to building an inclusive workforce by creating an environment where everyone feels like they belong and has the opportunity to be successful. We welcome of all applicants to join our diverse workforce and we will provide an accessible candidate experience including, but not limited to accommodations to interview sites and alternate formats upon request to our Recruitment team.

Title: Senior Data Management Analyst (Data Architecture)
Description:
Job Description Summary

Are you a data management professional with experience in Data Architecture and Data Lifecycle Management looking to join the largest biotech company in Canada? As the Data Management Architect, you will lead the design, implementation, and support of data management solutions that deliver needed structure, data flow, access, and data consistency across the information systems.

The Data Management Architect will champion building and maintaining an effective data architecture management practice at STEMCELL, interacting with business analysts, data owners, data management, and IT professionals. You will create the enterprise data model, and contribute to software implementation projects and the continuous improvement process.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities


Participate in projects to create data-related deliverables and/or review blueprints and solution design documents created by project teams
Assess existing data and business needs, collect, interpret, and document business requirements for data structure, integration, and data lifecycle management
Lead the adoption of data architecture standards and notations, maintain corporate-level data architecture artifacts, e.g. Enterprise Data Model, design data architecture management policies, standards, and guidelines
Design and implement improvements in data models, data flow, data entry procedures, access control, and data maintenance
Register and track data-related problems in the Data Issue Log, review and prioritize resolving data issues and technical debt


Knowledge And Qualifications


Bachelor's degree with 10+ years of relevant experience
Has a deep understanding of Enterprise Data Architecture concepts and artifacts
Required experience in applying data architecture descriptive languages and notations
Must have experience in Data Architecture, Data Modelling, and Data Integration
Desirable leadership experience in delivering data management solutions (e.g. Metadata, Master Data Management or Data Quality)


#united

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as ‚ÄúScientists Helping Scientists‚Äù ‚Äì standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative, and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and meaningful career development opportunities.

STEMCELL is well recognized for exceptional leadership and business practices. We are one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies and operate an ISO 14001-certified environmental management system to measure and reduce our environmental impact.

As an equal opportunity employer, STEMCELL is dedicated to ensuring that every employee feels safe, valued, and respected for who they are. We know that scientific progress and innovation occur when diverse, creative minds come together and we are committed to nurturing a culture of inclusivity and belonging. STEMCELL enforces a zero-tolerance policy for any form of discrimination. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

NOTE: STEMCELL‚Äôs vaccination policy requires that all candidates for this role be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including boosters), as currently recommended or required by local health authorities and public health orders, unless an exemption from this policy is approved through our accommodation request process.

To apply, please select the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button below. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account, which is required to apply.

Title: BI Developer
HTML:
BZAM Ltd. is as awesome as it sounds!

As a BI Developer at BZAM, you will report to the Senior Director, Eastern Canada Operations and Outdoor Cultivation and help lead the design, configuration, and support of data analysis and business insights at BZAM working in partnership with our incredible IT department. The role will be directly responsible in building the foundation on which BZAM will grow current and future data initiatives; providing tools and resources to internal stakeholders to help in identifying opportunities and risks. You will be jumping into a greenfield environment where you‚Äôll learn BZAM‚Äôs operations, objectives, and become an advocate and leader of data driven decisions.

Your Contribution

DATA MANAGEMENT
  • Develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data from multiple sources;
  • Develop and design data architecture and data warehouses;
  • Utilizes advanced analytics tools such as data mining, clustering and predictive models to expand and improve scoping of various initiatives;
  • Assists with enterprise initiatives to improve the collection or categorization of data; and
  • Applies conceptual thinking and critical reasoning to mine data and translate business needs into business insights.

BUSINESS INSIGHTS
  • Transform data into powerful visualizations;
  • Support various business units to make data driven decisions;
  • Use internal and external data to develop analytical models to support business analytical needs;

PROJECT MANAGEMENT
  • Work with all areas of the business including marketing, finance, sales, and operations to organize, analyze and report on data;
  • Leads project discussions with respect to data management solutions;
  • Provides training and/or support to users as needed; and
  • Works with stakeholders to ensure collaboration between BI environment and business requirements.

What You Bring

  • Able to communicate to multiple audiences and easily explain complex information to ensure the message is understood;
  • Continually assesses and adjusts priorities to manage tasks in a fast-paced and demanding environment;
  • Proven record of completing tasks and projects on-time; and
  • Able to work efficiently as part of a team as well as independently.

You Are ANALYTICALLY FOCUSED, capable of digging into data to provide actionable business reports.

You Are a CRITICAL THINKER, with a proactive mindset, solid organization, and communication skills.

You Are ADAPTABLE, capable of managing multiple parallel activities and shifting priorities as the business requires.

Your Experience

  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance or similar, with commensurate with experience;
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience, preferably in manufacturing for consumer packaged goods (CPG);
  • In-depth understanding of database management systems, online transactional processing (OTAP), online analytical processing (OLAP), and extract, transform, load (ETL) framework;
  • Experience with data warehousing concepts, data mining, and related tools in Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure;
  • Knowledge of programming language relevant to BI and analytics (SQL, Python, R, etc.);
  • Experience with visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI and Tableau;
  • Experience with relational and non-relational data sources; and
  • An interest in, and comfort with, technical concepts related to network and information security considered an asset.

What We Offer

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Minimum of Three Weeks Paid Vacation
  • Extended Health and Dental Group Benefits*
  • Health Care Spending Account*
  • RRSP Matching Program and TFSA options*
  • Rapid growth and advancement potential
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Dynamic and innovative environment
  • Exceptional culture
  • Eligible employees

BZAM Ltd. is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that values the strength of diversity within the workplace. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, nationality, age, disability or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law, are strongly encouraged to apply.

Title: Remote Support Specialist
Description:
Weir Motion Metrics is a Canadian mining technology division that enables a new generation of safe, smart, and sustainable mining. Based in Vancouver, B.C., the company joined forces with Weir, one of the world's leading engineering businesses, to empower mines by developing and deploying advanced monitoring solutions that address the industry's toughest challenges.
A diverse and tight-knit team of 100+ engineers, scientists, and professionals, Weir Motion Metrics colleagues share a passion for driving industry change through innovation by leveraging leading-edge, rugged camera technology and artificial intelligence. Through deep collaboration and industry expertise, Weir Motion Metrics prioritizes customer partnerships in productivity and safety. Serving the mining market since 1999, then joining Weir in 2021, Motion Metrics is proud to be Weir's first-ever center of excellence for artificial intelligence and machine vision technology.
Role purposes:

Support Data Analyst is responsible for monitoring Weir Motion Metrics systems to make sure all systems are performing as expected
Maintain on-site systems with up-to-date software and configurations suitable for specific equipment types.
Communicate with customers, the support team, and other departments to address any issues.
Collect data to analyze for any performance out of expectation.
Maintain records of product data and tickets for traceability and investigation
Execute update campaigns for systems deployed
Main backup for systems reviews reports for the team
Monitor and identify functional performance and improvements of different system modules.
Troubleshooting Windows and Linux OS, as well other company proprietary software.
Providing resolution to problems related to communication, networking, IP Routing, and synchronization.
Creating and documenting procedures that may be required by customers adapting the information to a customer-specific requirement.
Test, Reproduce and Troubleshoot failures detected and provide a solution promptly.
Performance event investigation, resolution, and mitigation for future events.

Key Relationships:
External:

Remote support contact for Customers under Services & Support agreements within the region.
Remote support outside the region assigned. *

Internal:

Regional/Country Services Manager
Global Services Team ‚Äì Global Remote Support Manager.
Field Support Specialist and Technical Account Managers.

Key Responsibilities:
Technical Services and Customer Satisfaction:

Check MetricsManager‚Ñ¢ Pro and on-site systems‚Äô performance daily, including ShovelMetrics‚Ñ¢, LoaderMetrics‚Ñ¢, and other products.
Generate reports and documents, both internal and customer-facing.
Generate reports for ShovelMetrics‚Ñ¢ Missing Tooth Detection, Fragmentation Analysis, Wear Monitoring, or other modules when required or when the events occur.
Communicate with other departments about systems performance.
Communicate with customers concerning system performance, software upgrades or any issues.
Communicate issues/bugs to Project Leads
Share alarm rate summary and analysis with customers at their needs.
Perform configuration and adjustment of parameters aligned with the Services Team indications or R&D department.
Data collection from different servers/customers.
Install, configure, maintain, and troubleshoot hardware and software systems.
Update system data, product data, and tickets in the tracking system.
Collect hardware failure information, communicate with the production department, and track the RMA process.
Remotely connect to client servers at mine sites to obtain performance data for system evaluation.
Ensure the implementation of Motion Metrics corporate technical guidelines, reporting results, and collaborating with the Global Development and Support & Service teams.
Create and maintain support documentation based on the customer or local team needs.

REQUIREMENTS:

Fast learner with knowledge of supporting multidisciplinary teams and equipment remotely.
Minimum 2 years of experience in Customer Support roles for industrial environments, with experience in pre-sales & post-sales.
Be fluent in English and possess excellent spoken and written skills.
Computer skills and experience in Networking, Office Suite, Windows & Linux OS, and communication systems.
Knowledge of databases, server environment support tools, and cloud services.
Be able to read and analyze documents, technical procedures, and government regulations.
Be professional with a positive attitude and work well under pressure to meet expected deadlines.
Can solve problems and propose solutions to issues that might arise.
Professional team player with a positive attitude and used to work under pressure to meet expected deadlines.
Ability to problem solve and propose solutions to issues that might arise
Accept assignments with open, cooperative, positive, and team-oriented attitudes.

We take pride in providing a quality workplace and promoting equal opportunities
for all. For additional information about Weir Motion Metrics, visit us at www.motionmetrics.com
#motionmetrics
#Hybrid
#Vancouver
